title: inout parameters
question: Which of these are true?
hint: inout parameters must be marked in your function wherever those functions are called.

correct.answer: Inout parameters are marked using the inout keyword.
Inout parameters must be passed in using &
Regular parameters are passed into functions as constants.
You can pass several parameters as inout if you want.
Changing Inout parameters inside a function changes them outside too.

wrong.reason: Inout parameters can be any kind of data type.
Inout parameters must be variable, so they can be changed.

wrong.answer: Inout parameters must be passed in using #
wrong.reason: This is invalid syntax in Swift.

wrong.answer: You may use up to three inout parameters.
wrong.reason: You may use as many inout parameters as you need.

wrong.answer: You can't use inout parameters in throwing functions.
wrong.reason: Inout parameters work in all types of functions, including throwing ones.

wrong.answer: You can mark return values as being inout.
wrong.reason: Return values are new values being sent back, rather than existing values being passed in.
